text: Today we are in Space 11, <https://www.openstreetmap.org/?mlat=52.381215&mlon=-1.561829#map=17/52.381215/-1.561829|Scarman Conference Centre>. text:
In the first half today, <@U029KUKC8P2> and I managed to merge the following issues on the <https://github.com/r-devel/glossary|{glossary}> repo:
• <https://github.com/r-devel/glossary/issues/6|Setup website using {pkgdown}>
• <https://github.com/r-devel/glossary/issues/10|Setup {precommit} on the repo>
• <https://github.com/r-devel/glossary/issues/12|Remove R CMD check (for now)>
• <https://github.com/r-devel/glossary/issues/8|Add {allcontributors} and corresponding action>

elements.text: and I managed to merge the following issues on the

text:
UPDATE: Tagged Yanina and Maëlle on the issue.

I fixed a small typo in the rOpenSci's {allcontributors} package repo but not sure who could review/approve <https://github.com/ropensci/allcontributors/pull/56|my PR>. I do see Maëlle Salmon as a contributor on the repo, is it okay to tag her? or we know anybody else who could help?

elements.text: I fixed a small typo in the rOpenSci's {allcontributors} package repo but not sure who could review/approve

Hello team! I made a post in social media  of the rladies gathered at today's R Dev Day in warwick, I share the links: <https://bsky.app/profile/rladies.org/post/3lynybrsxx72l|https://bsky.app/profile/rladies.org/post/3lynybrsxx72l>
 <https://www.linkedin.com/posts/rladies_rdevday-rladies-activity-7372349218566332416-UMfR?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAABvFTrcBKGmB0_kdUiOTf07yP7-SUndUEnU|https://www.linkedin.com/posts/rladies_rdevday-rladies-activity-7372349218566332416-UMfR?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAABvFTrcBKGmB0_kdUiOTf07yP7-SUndUEnU>
 <https://hachyderm.io/@RLadiesGlobal/115192954968028231|https://hachyderm.io/@RLadiesGlobal/115192954968028231>

attachments.fallback:
<https://bsky.app/profile/rladies.org|@rladies.org>: R Developer Day at University of Warwick brought together R-Ladies from around the world :earth_americas:. 

Spaces like this remind us how powerful our global community is when we learn, collaborate and build together.

Thanks to Heather Turner for making this possible :purple_heart:

#rladies
